item.title: Pokemon x Yogibo Jumbo Bean Bag Chairs Go On Sale
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon and Yogibo offer giant bean bag chairs of Gengar, Jigglypuff, and Lechonk, perfect for fans and decor enthusiasts alike.
  • Ditto and Snorlax bean bag chairs from past collabs were popular and sold out quickly, so fans should act fast.
  • These 30x30x30 inch, 12 pound bean bag chairs are limited and priced at $299.99 each, shipping in mid-October.

The Pokemon Company and Yogibo are teaming up to sell a popular trio of Pokemon, namely Gengar, Jigglypuff, and Lechonk, as giant bean bag chairs. The Pokemon recreations are functional and cuddly-looking, but could also serve as decor for fans of the series.

Pokemon and Yogibo have previously cooperated to produce bean bag chairs. Ditto and Snorlax previously got the bean bag chair treatment from Yogibo, though both have sold out since. Pokemon fans interested in buying a nice bean bag chair shouldn't wait too long, as these new bean bags may also see high demand.

Related
Pokemon Kanto Region Recreated in Terraria
One Terraria player is showing off their creative journey to replicate the Mt. Moon area from Pokemon Red and Blue in Terraria.

The Pokemon Center is now officially selling new Yogibo Pokemon bean bag chairs . Gengar, Lechonk, and Jigglypuff each received a chair that's big enough for adults to sit on. Each chair reproduces the Pokemon in charming detail, giving fans a jumbo Pokemon plush that's perfect to snuggle up with or simply sit on. Each bean bag chair features a removable cover for easy cleaning, and has an interior zipper child lock to help prevent unwanted access to the bean bag chair's filling.

These bean bag chairs are quite sizable, coming in at 30 x 30 x 30 inches each. The weight is also significant, coming in at a whopping 12 pounds. Due to its size and limited nature, the three bean bag chairs are being sold for $299.99 each. All three chairs are set to ship in mid-October, which could see Gengar arriving in time for Halloween for some fans. Unlike The Pokemon Center's Squishmallows , fans shouldn't expect these bean bag chairs to be sold anywhere else at a later date.

The Pokemon Chosen for the Yogibo Collab

Although Pikachu and starter Pokemon trios often get the most attention for collectible products, the Yogibo collection hasn't highlighted them. Of the Pokemon to see a Yogibo collab, Snorlax's sleepy nature makes it a perfect choice for a Yogibo bean bag chair, and Jigglypuff's ability to put people and Pokemon to sleep seems like a good choice, as well. Ditto's unusual design and malleable shape also make it an interesting choice. While Gengar and Lechonk don't have direct connections to rest or relaxation, Gengar has been an extremely popular Pokemon since Gen 1, and Lechonk took the internet by storm when Pokemon Scarlet and Violet first revealed its design. This popularity likely gave them an edge over other potential choices.

For fans who don't want to spend this much money, a nearly endless variety of other Pokemon decor options exist. From plushes to projectors, almost every Pokemon has been featured in some way for fans to collect, just as they do the actual creatures in-game.

item.title: Pokemon Kanto Region Recreated in Terraria
item.description:
Highlights

  • A gamer known as EaldorPrime on Reddit recreates Mt. Moon and other locations from Kanto in Terraria without mods, using creative tactics for 3D movement in 2D.
  • The detailed replica includes tunnels and a Yellow Volt Bunny, mimicking Pikachu, impressing fans with its accuracy.
  • While not the first Kanto location in a non-Pokemon game, EaldorPrime's creation shows the enduring love for Pokemon's original region.

One dedicated Terraria player has used their creative skills to transform their in-game world into a replica of Mt. Moon and its surrounding areas from the original Pokemon games. While Terraria takes place in a side-scrolling 2D landscape and Pokemon allows for 3D movement with a top-down view, this player utilized their years of experience with the game to make the transition work.

Mt. Moon is located in the Kanto region from Pokemon Red and Blue , although other Pokemon games have allowed the player to go there as well. It's found between Routes 3 and 4, and players will have to spelunk through a cave system in the mountain on their journey between Pewter City and Cerulean City.

Related
Terraria: 13 Map Seeds That Make The Game Even Harder
From the dangers of the Jungle Biome to a barren land with no ocean, these challenging map seeds might confound even Terraria veterans!

The creator of this new fan-made Mt. Moon, who goes by the Reddit handle EaldorPrime, introduced it as part six in their series of Kanto replicas made in Terraria . In order to craft the replica of Mt. Moon using Terraria 's building tools, EaldorPrime had to get creative to allow 3D movement in the 2D game. Since characters in Terraria can jump but not walk upward or downward on the screen, the player has filled the area with Echo Platforms, which can be leaped to but cannot be seen under normal circumstances. The creator says they have been playing Terraria for almost 13 years and have logged about 3,000 hours of playtime so far, and impressively, they created this world with no Terraria mods , although they did utilize "a lot for paint."

Almost An Exact Replica of Mt. Moon in Terraria

The version of Mt. Moon presented by this creator is almost an exact scale replica of the one appearing in Pokemon Red and Blue , right down to the tunnels that lead the player to other parts of the cave system. Probably the biggest difference between the remade Mt. Moon and the original is that the version in Terraria isn't filled with wild Pokemon like Zubat and Clefairy that jump out and start random battles with the player. There is a stand-in for one Pokemon, however, as the creator has opted to use a Lightning Carrot to summon a yellow Volt Bunny to follow the player character around, much like Pikachu would trail behind the main character in Pokemon Yellow . This particular attention to detail seems to have drawn the most delight out of fans who have seen the Mt. Moon build, along with the clothing choices that make the player character look like Ash Ketchum from the Pokemon anime.

While this fan's recreation of Mt. Moon is certainly impressive, it's not the first time a player has added a Kanto location to a non- Pokemon game. Earlier in 2024, another creator shared a stunning replica of the Kanto region made in Minecraft , which goes to show the appreciation players still have for Pokemon 's original region.

item.title: World of Warcraft Heritage Quest Has Big News for the Draenei
item.description:
Highlights

  • Draenei Heritage quest in WoW Patch 10.2.7 reveals plans for a new city on Azeroth, a big deal after 17 years without a true home.
  • Complete the Heritage Armor questlines for Trolls and Draenei in Patch 10.2.7, unlocking cosmetic rewards and exciting storylines.
  • Fans rejoice as Draenei leader Velen announces a new city on Azuremyst Isle, marking a significant moment for the race's future.

The Draenei Heritage quest from World of Warcraft Patch 10.2.7 confirms plans to build a new city on Azeroth. This new World of Warcraft city is a huge deal for the Draenei, who have been without a true home for about 17 years, both in and out of the game.

World of Warcraft Patch 10.2.7, Dark Heart, is the final content update before The War Within ’s pre-patch. The update added several new storylines, including epilogues for Dragonflight , a Void-themed narrative bridge between the WoW expansions , and Heritage Armor questlines for Trolls and Draenei, each of which grants players several cosmetic rewards.

Related
You Can Do More Than Pet The Cat in World of Warcraft: The War Within
World of Warcraft fans who fancy felines should look forward to The War Within, as they can do more than simply pet the cats they encounter.

While all of these new questlines have been popular among fans, the Draenei quest in particular has a huge revelation that could spell something big for the race's future. At the end of their new Heritage quest, shortly before they unlock the World of Warcraft Heritage Armor rewards , players are treated to a short cinematic where Velen addresses the crowd gathered for the Tishamaat – a ceremony of remembrance revived during the quest – during which the Draenei leader reveals they are building a new city to live in on Azuremyst Isle.

World of Warcraft Draenei Heritage Quest Rewards

  • Endurance of Temple Telhamat (Orange) and Embrace of Lost Embaari (Purple) Heritage Armor sets.
    • Each comes with two headpieces – one featuring a face covering, and another without it.

  • The Draenic Hologem; a Hearthstone toy usable only by Draenei and Lightforged Draenei.

When the Draenei were first introduced in World of Warcraft: The Burning Crusade , they crash-landed on Azuremyst Isle. Their starting experience largely involved navigating the wreckage of the Exodar and establishing a foothold. However, in the 17 real years since the expansion was released, and the over 15 in-game years since their crash, the Draenei have not had a true home beyond the wreckage of the Exodar.

Needless to say, Draenei fans were overjoyed with the news of a new city, and loved the Heritage quest in general. Players have been hoping the Draenei would finally set down roots now that the Burning Legion is gone, and most agree the Heritage questline was the perfect place to do that. What’s more, the announcement of this new city has some fans wondering if the Azuremyst and Bloodmist Isles will eventually get a revamp, like how the Eversong Woods is in WoW: Midnight .

The Draenei Heritage quest is full of other incredible details as well. Draenei characters, both old and new, are involved with the Tishamaat, including the Eredar who became playable during Dragonflight ’s previous quest, and main-universe versions of characters previously only seen on Alternate Draenor. This, combined with two color variants of Heritage armor and a special Hearthstone, has led the Draenei questline to be as well-received as World of Warcraft standouts like the Orc Heritage quest .

item.title: Pokemon Fan Creates Incredible Statues of Groudon and Kyogre in Minecraft
item.description:
Highlights

  • Minecraft players showcase their creativity through massive sculptures like Groudon vs. Kyogre, impressing fans of both games.
  • Players appreciate the time and effort pleinair1212 put into recreating the iconic battle scene, sparking interest in more Pokemon-themed builds.
  • While Pokemon and Minecraft have not officially collaborated, fans continue to merge the two worlds through stunning creations like this statue.

A Pokemon fan and Minecraft player has created a stunning statue of Groudon and Kyogre mid-battle. The Minecraft sculpture is huge and is impressing fans of both games at the design and work put into it.

Minecraft gives players the creative freedom to build massive recreations of real-world sculptures, cities, or pay tribute to other games with statues like these. While every Minecraft player has their own way of enjoying the game, community members eagerly share praise for those who put in the time and effort to make their design dreams come true.

Related
Pokemon Fan Art Gives Crustle a Minecraft-Inspired Makeover
One talented Pokemon fan creates a new version of Crustle that gives a look into what a crossover with Minecraft could be like.

Such is the case with Minecraft player pleinair1212, who shared their incredible Pokemon build . The 100x100 statue features Groudon and Kyogre, with Groudon swiping at Kyogre, who is leaping overhead. The fan appears to have based the poses off of the two's signature attack moves, Precipice Blades and Origin Pulse, respectively. The build is rounded out with the sea and lava crashing together, further amplifying the conflict between these two Pokemon.

Fans in the comments are thoroughly impressed with the build, sharing their appreciation for the amount of time and effort the artist must have spent on it. Players were pleased to see the Groudon and Kyogre conflict recreated, with one calling for more Pokemon battle scenes to be built in Minecraft in general. Several shared their hopes that the artist would post schematics of the statue so that they could potentially build their own. However, at the time of writing, the artist hadn't responded to these requests.

Pokemon and Minecraft

Pokemon and Minecraft are two games that have shown that they can withstand the test of time. While Minecraft and Pokemon have never had an official collaboration, that hasn't stopped fans from frequently combining the two. Players have recreated Pokemon 's Goldenrod City in Minecraft , as well as numerous individual Pokemon. Some fans have also taken to combining Minecraft and Pokemon in other ways, with one sharing their concept for what Minecraft mobs would look like as Pokemon.

Players have also made connections between the games before, at least with regard to their art style and Pokemon designs. Fans pointed out that Nacli and its evolutions look like they popped out of Minecraft due to the blocky design the creatures have. While a Pokemon and Minecraft crossover might not be in the cards, players are more than happy to keep combining the two franchises.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Reveals Helpful New Version 2.2 Tools
item.description:
Highlights

  • Update to Version 2.2 brings new characters Robin and Boothill, along with new locations like Dreamflux Reef and Penacony Grand Theater.
  • HoYoLab tools like Maps, Battle Records, and Leveling Calculator have all been updated to help players navigate and progress efficiently.
  • Discord users can now link their game account with the new Mimo Bot tool, with plans to expand functions for other HoYoverse games in the future.

Honkai: Star Rail received numerous new HoYoLab tools that will aid player progression in the newly released Version 2.2 update. By using the new tools, players will be able to track their progress in the new map and learn how to level up new characters efficiently in Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.2

The May 8 update for Honkai: Star Rail , Version 2.2 marks the beginning of the end for the Penacony storyline that began in Version 2.0. In Version 2.2, Honkai: Star Rail players also witness the debut of playable five-star characters Robin and Boothill, both of whom are available to draw from new Event Wishes. New Dreamscapes and locations are available to explore in Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.2 as well, such as the Dreamflux Reef and Penacony Grand Theater. Once more, HoYoLab has been updated to help new and returning players in Honkai: Star Rail .

Related
All Active Honkai: Star Rail Redeem Codes (May 2024)
Stellar Jades is a crucial currency in Honkai: Star Rail as players need them to get new characters in the game.

HoYoverse's HoYoLab website for Honkai: Star Rail receives new and updated tools that will help players explore the new Version 2.2 content. Firstly, the Honkai: Star Rail Maps tool has been updated with maps for the new Dreamflux Reef, SoulGlad Scorchsand Audition Venue, and Penacony Grand Theater areas. These maps display three-dimensional maps in different layers, which allows players to survey the maps with great detail. Battle Records were also updated with new character background images and widgets for Robin and Boothill, alongside a new detailed character stats view. The Leveling Calculator now has entries for Honkai: Star Rail's Robin and Boothill , letting players plan out their grind for new character leveling materials. Once ready, players may use the Lineup Assistant to view and share optimal team comps for the Memory of Chaos end-game activity.

Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.2 New and Updated Tools

  • Maps tool now supports and displays the Dreamflux Reef, SoulGlad Scorchsand Audition Venue, and Penacony Grand Theater areas
  • Battle Records adds character backgrounds and widgets for Robin and Boothill
  • New detailed character stats view in Battle Records
  • Leveling Calculator entries for Robin and Boothill
  • New Mimo Bot for Discord

HoYoverse also launched the new Mimo Bot tool for Discord, allowing players to link their game account and share information directly with others. Currently, Mimo Bot supports Honkai: Star Rail only, but HoYoverse plans on expanding its functions and supported games. This means that the Discord feature will likely be compatible with Genshin Impact , Honkai Impact 3rd , and Zenless Zone Zero in the future.

Those logging into HoYoLab may also benefit from the Check In tool for Version 2.2, which offers free Stellar Jades for Honkai: Star Rail players that login for three consecutive days. The Trailblaze Monthly Calculator, which is only accessible from the HoYoLab mobile app, is also available for those wanting to track their earnings of Stellar Jades, Star Rail Passes, and Star Rail Special Passes during the month.

Honkai: Star Rail 's Version 2.3 update is expected to be released sometime in June with more new limited-time events. Fans can also expect further updates to HoYoLab, since the update will bring new features and playable characters.
